Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello GM,

My apologies for the bug reporting situation. Our jira deploymen=
t is used
for a whole bunch of projects, and almost everything on there is =
internal
to archive.org. At some point not long ago, a decision was made to=
 disallow
self-signup to the general public. I wasn't aware of that until n=
ow.

So, I enabled github issues. There's no easy way to migrate jira issue=
s to
github, so old stuff will stay put, but please submit new issues on gi=
thub.

As for your checkpointing issue, are you sure the crawl did make pro=
gress?
Maybe now you can file an issue on github with more details.

Noah

=

On Fri, Mar 25, 2016 at 3:43 AM, sexxxenator@... [archive-crawler] <=

archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I'm using heritrix =
for a while now (currently: 3.2.0), and I've noticed
> several bugs.
>
> Un=
fortunately, github "issue" reporting is disabled and
> https://webarchive.=
jira.com/projects/HER/issues is not opened for
> external account creation =
(at least for people with @gmail accounts like
> me). As a consequence, it =
is impossible to report any bug found... This is
> not a very "open" attitu=
de to the community/your users :{ And it does not
> help improving the code=
.
>
>
> Notably, I discovered recenty that adding "-Djava.util.logging.conf=
ig.file=3D/path/to/logging.properties
> -Dlog4j.debug -Dlog4j.configuration=
=3Dfile:/path/to/log4j.properties" to the
> commandline running heritrix (i=
n my case: bin/heritrix -s
> keystore.jks,xxx,xxx -a admin:admin" -p 8845 -=
b /) makes the software
> incapable of creating a checkpoint.
>
> Also, the=
 message reported when this occurs is: "Checkpoint not made --
> perhaps no=
 progress since last? (see logs)", which is misleading since
> there's abso=
lutely nothing in the logs!!!
>
>
> I wasted 2 weeks to find where the prob=
lem was, so it would be great if I
> could have reported this bug (easily),=
 so that it could be corrected, or,
> at least, other people would not wast=
e as much time as I did...
>
>
> My 2 cents
>
>
> GM
>
>
> 
>

--001a11c1b742bfdacf052f34cb07

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi,<br><br>I'm using heritr=
ix for a while now (currently: 3.2.0), and I've noticed several bugs.<b=
r><br>Unfortunately, github "issue" reporting is disabled and <a =
rel=3D"nofollow" href=3D"https://webarchive.jira.com/projects/HER/issues" t=
arget=3D"_blank">https://webarchive.jira.com/projects/HER/issues</a> is not=
 opened for external account creation (at least for people with @gmail acco=
unts like me). As a consequence, it is impossible to report any bug found..=
. This is not a very "open" attitude to the community/your users =
:{ And it does not help improving the code.<br><p><br></p><p>Notably, I dis=
covered recenty that adding "<span>-Djava.util.logging.config.file=3D/=
path/to/logging.properties -Dlog4j.debug -Dlog4j.configuration=3Dfile:/path=
/to/log4j.properties" to the commandline running heritrix (in my case:=
 bin/heritrix -s keystore.jks,xxx,xxx -a admin:admin" -p 8845 -b /) ma=
kes the software incapable of creating a checkpoint.</span></p><p><span>Als=
o,
  the message reported when this occurs is: "</span>Checkpoint not =
made -- perhaps no progress since last? (see logs)<span>", which is mi=
sleading since there's absolutely nothing in the logs!!!<br></span></p>=
<p><br><span></span></p><p><span>I wasted 2 weeks to find where the problem=
 was, so it would be great if I could have reported this bug (easily), so t=
hat it could be corrected, or, at least, other people would not waste as mu=
ch time as I did...</span></p><p><br><span></span></p><p><span>My 2 cents</=
span></p><p><br><span></span></p><p><span>GM<br></span></p>





<br>


<br=

ote></div><br></div>
